channel.title: [317-508]LandScape Editor?
channel.description:
Is this possible?? I've known now for a while that it is possible with RSC Servers but what about the newer servers? I figure it has something to do with the client files and their cache. This would be a great tool for adding things you wanted Example. Custom city without having to spawn global objects taking up space in your server files. Move a few houses to another place. Make edgevill covered in snow without having to do the whole annoying thing with hard coding the clients.
This is just an Idea we should work on. Who Supports?
IF JAGEX CAN DO IT WHY CAN'T WE??!
Moderators please don't lock this.

They have professional java programmers & software engineers. And they hire for people with experience in java c++ & c so i’m guessing they use those 3.[/quote]

item.title: [317-508]LandScape Editor?
item.dc:creator: @Goodoo_dolls Goodoo dolls
item.description:
@Goodoo_dolls wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:7, topic:250984”]He’s implying that you post it in the client section, which isn’t the wrong section, but it isn’t the right section.

If you’re talking about making new map data:
I don’t think there really is a way. At least that i know of. People have asked this question a few times, and it’s built in a way that would require you to like… reform it whilst editing it at the same time. I don’t really understand it, but from everything I’ve heard, you’re not in any luck.[/quote]

That seems Logical I dont see any other way you could de it other than remakign the maps.

latin king:

talk crap all you want cuz thats all you eat.

Dude STFU adn GTFO my thread.

Read full topic

item.title: [317-508]LandScape Editor?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

He’s implying that you post it in the client section, which isn’t the wrong section, but it isn’t the right section.

If you’re talking about making new map data:
I don’t think there really is a way. At least that i know of. People have asked this question a few times, and it’s built in a way that would require you to like… reform it whilst editing it at the same time. I don’t really understand it, but from everything I’ve heard, you’re not in any luck.

Read full topic
